page.title: 17Reconstrution of Hampden
page.content: Hampden football stadium belongs to Queen's Park Amateur Football Club. The ground is often used by other clubs in internationals, cup finals and European cup finals. The stadium has a capacity of 70-75000. However, just now the ground is being reconstructed. After the reconstruction the ground will be able to hold 85,000. The reconstruction will cost about Â£2 million. The money will be spent on covering the terracing, new toilets, snack bars, turnstiles and new seating in the stand. Every time a big game is played at Hampden Queens Park are given 25% of the profit. This is necessary since Queens Park have such small crowds and it costs about Â£700,000 to run Hampden all season. Tickets for the big games can cost as much as Â£12 for the stand.
